alert.note: Alert for Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 12 at 7:25AM EST until March 12 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Northwest winds gusting around 50 to 55 mph. * WHERE...Central Virginia Blue Ridge and Northern Virginia Blue Ridge. * WHEN...Until 3 PM EST this afternoon. Snow will be heavy at times through mid-morning before tapering off to a lighter snow late this morning into early this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds combined with heavy wet snow will cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of snow and blowing snow will reduce visibility below one-quarter mile. Blizzard conditions are most likely between 7 AM and Noon. Snowfall rates around one to two inches per hour are expected this morning.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Central Virginia Blue Ridge; Northern Virginia Blue Ridge
